gurmukhi: eyk BUp C`qRI ifg nwmw ]prXo qwih ikrlw ko jwmw ]sB jwdv imil Kyln Awey ]pXwsy Bey kUp ipK Dwey ]2243]
transliteration: Ek Bhoop Chhattridig Naamaa|| Ddaryo Taah(i) Kirlaa Kirlaa Ko Jaamaa|| Sabh Jaadav Mil(i) Khelan Aae|| Phaase Bhae Koop Pikh Dhaae||2243||
translation: There was a Kshatriya king named Dig, who was born as a chameleon; when all the Yadavas were playing, then being thirsty, they came to a well.2243.

gurmukhi: iek ikrlw iqh mwih inhwrXo ]kwFY Xwko iehY ibcwrXo ]kwFn lgy n kwFXo gXo ]Aiq Ascrj sBihn mn BXo ]2244]
transliteration: Ik Kirlaa Tih Maah(i) Nihdaryo|| Kaadhai Yaako Ihai Bichaarryo|| Kaadhan Lage Na Kaadhyo Gado|| At(i) Ascharaj Sabh-hin Man Bhayo||2244||
translation: Seeing a chameleon in the well, they all thought of taking it out; they made efforts, but noticing thief failure, they all felt amazed.2244.
Speech of the Yadavas addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: sB su icMq jwdv Bey gey kiRSn pY Dwie ]kih ikrlw iek kUp mY qw ko krhu aupwie ]2245]
transliteration: Sabh Su Chint Jaadav Bhae Gad Krishan Pai Dhaae|| Kah(i) Kridaa Ik Koop Mai Taa Kodaroh Oupaae||2245||
translation: Thinking about this, all of them, came to Krishna and said, “There is a chameleon in the well; adopt some measure and take it out.”2245.

gurmukhi: sunq hI bwqY sB jwdv kI jdurwie jwinE sB Byd khI bwq muskwie kY ]khw vh kUp khw pirE hY ikrlw qw mY bolq BXo XO muih dIjIAY idKwie kY ]
transliteration: Sounat Hibaatai Sabh Jaadav Kijaduraae Jaanio Sabh Bhed Kahibaat Mouskaae Kai|| Kahaa Vah Koop Kahaa Pario Hai Kirlaa Taa Mai Dolat Bhayo Yau Muh(i) Deejeeai Dikhaae Kai||
translation: Hearing the world of Yadavas, and understanding the whole mystery, Krishna said smilingly, “Where is that well, show it to me.”

gurmukhi: Awgy Awgy soaU Gn sXwm iqn pwCY pwCY clq clq jo inhwrXo soaU jwie kY ]imit gey pwp qw ky eyko n rhn pwey BXo nr jbY hir lIno hY auTwie kY ]2246]
transliteration: Ooge Aage Sooo Ghan Syaam Tin Paachhai Paachhai Chalat Chalat Jo Nihdaryo Sooo Jaae Kai|| Mittee Gad Paap Taa Ke Eko Na Rahan Paae Bhayo Nar Jabai Har(i) Leeno Hai Outhaae Kai||2246||
translation: The Yadavas led and Krishna followed and reaching there he saw in the well; when Krishna caught that chameleon, all its sins ended and it was transformed into a man.2246.

gurmukhi: qw hI kI moC BeI iCn mY ijn eyk GrI Gn sXwm jU DXwXo ]Aaur qrI gnkw qb hI ijh hwQ lXo suk suk sXwm pVHwXo ]
transliteration: Taa Hikimochh Bhaichhin Mai Jin Ek Gharighan Syaam Joo Dhyaayo|| Aur Tarigadkaa Tab Hijih Haath Layo Souk Syaam Padhaayo||
translation: He, who remembered Krihsna for an instant, he was redeemed; instructing the parrot, Ganika obtained salvation;

gurmukhi: ko n qrXo jg mY nr jwih nrwien ko icq nwm bswXo ]eyqy pY ikau n qrY ikrlw ijh ko hir Awpn hwQ lgwXo ]2247]
transliteration: Ko Na Daryo Jag Mai Nar Jaah(i) Naraain Ko Chit Naam Basaayo|| Ete Pai Kio Na Darai Kirlaa Jih Ko Har(i) Aappan Haath Lagadyo2247||
translation: Who is there such an individual, who has remembered the Lord (Narayana) and did not ferry across the world-ocean; then this chameleon, which was thouched by Krishna, why it should not be redeemed?247.

gurmukhi: jb hI soaU sXwm auTwie lXo ]qb mwnuK ko soaU byK BXo ]qb XO biRjnwQ su bYn rry ]qh dysu khw qh nwm Ary ]2248]
transliteration: Jab Hisooo Syaam Outhaae Layo|| Tab Maanoukh Ko Sooo Bekh Bhayo|| Tab Yau Brijnaath Su Bain Dare|| Tah Des(u) Kahaa Tah Naamdare||2248||
translation: When Krishna took it up, it was transformed into a man; then Krishna asked, “What is your name, and which is your country?”2248.
Speech of the chameleon addressed to Krishna:
